text:
Efforts to erase voting rights, trans rights, and abortion rights for millions of people are escalating across the country. 

We're responding on all fronts, with the full strength of the ACLU.

You can join the fight by supporting this urgent work here ⬇
https://t.co/8W3ZRuFbYt
Meanwhile, we and our affiliates have continued the work for our First Amendment right to protest, freedom of the press, immigrants’ rights, racial justice, womens’ rights, and more.

We’re suing Georgia for its illegal voter suppression law, which violates the:
✔️ First Amendment
✔️ Fourteenth Amendment
✔️ Fifteenth Amendment
✔️ Voting Rights Act
✔️ Americans with Disabilities Act
✔️ Civil Rights Act of 1964
And more. https://t.co/73pfnExYtI

Our challenge to Arkansas's ban on gender-affirming care was the first of several challenges to anti-trans laws that we plan to file this year, in response to a record number of anti-trans laws.

We filed our lawsuit against West Virginia’s trans athlete ban the very next day.

Arkansas’s abortion ban is one of over 530 anti-abortion laws introduced across the country just this year. 

We know the right to abortion is under attack from extremist politicians nationwide and are prepared to fight with our partners for the long haul.

We will not back down.

We’ve sued Arkansas twice this week. First, we sued over its discriminatory and offensive ban on health care for trans youth. 

Yesterday we also sued over its illegal abortion ban. 

Both of these state laws are dangerous and unconstitutional.

We’ve been even busier than usual lately, filing lawsuits to defend access to abortion, stop state legislative attacks on trans youth, and fight voter suppression, among others.

Let’s talk about a few of these.
